alert.note: Alert for Izard; Stone (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 10:20AM CDT until March 27 at 8:17AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Newport affecting Jackson and Independence Counties. White River At Batesville affecting Independence County. White River At Calico Rock affecting Stone and Izard Counties. White River At Georgetown affecting Prairie, White and Woodruff Counties. White River At Des Arc affecting Prairie County. White River At Augusta affecting White and Woodruff Counties. White River At Clarendon affecting Arkansas and Monroe Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Calico Rock. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Pastures in Izard and Stone counties begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday afternoon, March 25th, to a crest of 20.0 feet the same evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight, March 26th. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Crest Time Date White River Calico Roc 19.0 17.3 Sat 9 AM 15.9 10.0 7.6 20.0 7 PM 3/25 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
